
My view is that we need to return this to the user, whether it should be by default can be discussed (like we can have a channel arg or something to enable it). I would prefer to keep it by default. I think we can start by measuring whether there is observable performance gain with this PR.

People may need it for either telling the lang/version of their client to do some custom thing accordingly, or adding some custom part to the user-agent string.

I agree with Yang that the default should be to continue surfacing this. Even though it's a **SHOULD** on the HTTP spec, it is existing behavior and likely to be utilized by at least some users for variant content, etc.
